channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Pothole 18 inch by 10 inch by at least 6 inch deep, 7th February
item.description:
Location: Heading up Leckhamtom Hill 100 mtrs before Starr Colege turnoff. This pothole was reported on the 18th Jan, was inspected on the 20th and no action was decided even though the report said it caused damage to tyre.(FixMyStreet ref: 8723685) I HAVE JUST HAD MY TYRE DAMAGED on this hole which should have been repaired weeks ago!! I am having a new tyre fitted tomorrow and checks on car. I will be taking action to recover my costs for what was an avoidable action. Please provide Claim Form. The location of this hole means that when any car is on the opposite side of the road you are forced into it. This a very urgent repair request. Tried to report on Emergency line but line very busy!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): B4070, Coberley, Cotswold
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large puddle in front of school crossing, 7th February
item.description:
The remedial work to the crossing across Evesham Road has left a long and deep depression immediately in front of the crossing which does not drain. The two drains nearby are too high to drain that area, even when they are not clogged with leaves. This causes a very big puddle which vehicles cannot easily avoid, so children going to school need to stand well back from the road to avoid being splashed. This puts them into the cycle lane. The puddle can last for over a day without rain.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Central Cross Drive, Marle Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: No rain in 24 hours - water has increased or remained the same

item.title: The cycle path needs sweeping, 7th February
item.description:
The cycle path from junction of commerce Road and Cheltenham Road East to Arle court roundabout needs sweeping. There is lots of small bits of gravel, mud (where water collects) and debris from trees all along the path. Itâ€™s getting slippery in the wet weather and is particularly hazardous for those using road bikes. Please could it be properly swept. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Meteor Business Park, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet
